items.title: Roborock launches its first robot lawn mower in the US
items.summary: Roborock is finally bringing its bots to yards in the US, several months after expanding into robot lawn mowers last year. The Roborock RockMow X1 LiDAR, announced today at CES, will be launching later this year, featuring autonomous navigation, all-wheel drive, and 360-degree 3D scanning using a combination of LiDAR and Visual Simultaneous Localization and […]

items.title: Roborock’s new Saros 20 robot vacuum cleaners got a climbing upgrade
items.summary: Roborock's latest robovacs don't need help getting out of tricky situations. At least, that's one of the perks of the improved AdaptiLift Chassis 3.0 on the Roborock Saros 20 and Saros 20 Sonic announced today at CES 2026. The upgraded chassis in Roborock's new flagship robot vacuum cleaners allows the bots to climb over thresholds […]

items.title: Roborock’s Rover walks, jumps, and vacuums your stairs
items.summary: I've been reviewing robot vacuums for almost a decade, and one question I hear repeatedly is "When will it clean my stairs?" Well, we finally have an answer. Sort of. At CES 2026 this week, Roborock launched the Saros Rover, a robot vacuum with articulating legs on wheels that let it climb a full staircase […]

items.title: You might mistake Satechi’s new Thunderbolt 5 hub for Apple’s Mac Mini
items.summary: Satechi is launching a new dock that supports Intel's Thunderbolt 5 technology - and it looks a lot like an Apple Mac Mini. The Thunderbolt 5 CubeDock fits an NVMe SSD enclosure and several ports inside a relatively compact form factor, measuring 5 inches wide and 2 inches tall. And at $399.99, the device is […]

items.title: You can now use Abbott’s OTC glucose monitors with Withings
items.summary: Withings isn't done with CES 2026 announcements just yet. The French health tech company just announced a new partnership with Abbott. In the first quarter of the year, Abbott Lingo users will be able to view their glucose data within the Withings app. Lingo is Abbott's over-the-counter continuous glucose monitor (CGM) for nondiabetic people. Withings […]

items.title: Roborock finally adds a roller mop to its vast robot vacuum lineup
items.summary: The market leader in robot vacuums has been behind in the latest trend - roller mops. But not for much longer. At CES this week, Roborock announced the Qrevo Curv 2 Flow, its first robot vacuum and mop with a motorized self-cleaning roller mop. The Flow features an extra-wide mop that the company says can […]

items.title: Satechi debuts new Mac mini-style Thunderbolt 5 CubeDock, keyboards, more at CES 2026 – score 20% off all of it
items.summary:
CES 2026 is well underway now, and today we are getting our first official look at the new Satechi lineup. Among our favorite accessory makers out there, this year it is delivering an all-new Thunderbolt 5 CubeDock with triple 4K/144Hz monitor support, Thunderbolt 5 downstream ports, and a 180W smart power supply. Those also joins its most advanced Thunderbolt 5 cable to date and the next-gen lineup of Slim EX keyboards and a new mouse. The best part, you can now score 20% pre-orders for all of it using code CES2026 at checkout on the official site.

more…

items.title: Razer’s Project AVA desktop hologram from CES 2026 is a fancy personal AI assistant for your battlestation
items.summary:
Razer is known for dishing out some crazy CES announcements, and this year is no exception. The brand rolled out a wide range of new offerings – some that you’ll eagerly want to add to your battlestations, and others that feel more impressive on paper than in real-world appeal. Arguably the most intriguing reveal is the physical, holographic version of Project AVA, the assistant it first teased last year. Yes, Razer is looking to bring Project AVA directly to your desk in a sci-fi–inspired enclosure, complete with an HD eye-tracking camera and a far-field microphone. Hit the jump for more details.

more…

items.title: Tackle mowing in a new way for 2026 with Segway’s Navimow i and X3 series robots at up to $700 off from $799
items.summary:
By way of its official Navimow Amazon storefront, Segway is offering its Navimow i110N Robot Lawn Mower at $1,099 shipped, which matches its direct website pricing, while the smaller Navimow i105N Robot Lawn Mower is down at $799 shipped, also matching its direct website pricing. What’s more, you can also find discounts on the more advanced X3 series of robots down below the fold. The i110N and i105N robots are coming down from their $1,299 and $999 price tags here, with this being the second-lowest price for the i110N and the fourth-lowest price for the i105N, which both went as low as $864 and $664 in 2025. You’re still looking at a solid $200 markdown on both models, allowing you to upgrade your lawn care with more autonomous assistance so you can focus your attention elsewhere around the house.

items.title: German inflation estimated at 2.2 pct in 2025
items.summary: BERLIN, Jan. 6 (Xinhua) -- The price growth in Germany slowed more than expected to 1.8 percent in December 2025, preliminary data showed on Tuesday, putting annual inflation at 2.2 percent for 2025. Read full story

One notable deal is Jackery’s HomePower 3600 Plus Portable Power Station at $1,519.05 shipped, after using the code NEW5 at checkout for additional savings, which also beats out its Amazon pricing by $80. Released back in September, we’ve been seeing it regularly discounted from its $2,799 MSRP, with previous Black Friday and Christmas sales having dropped the costs to $1,795 and $1,614. You’re looking at the second-lowest price we have tracked here, with $1,280 total savings off the MSRP that is only beaten out by the $1,499 low we saw pop up during October’s Prime Day event. items.title: Segway unveils the Myon and Muxi e-bikes and the Xaber 300 electric dirt bike at CES 2026
items.summary:
Hot out of CES 2026, Segway has unveiled three new e-bikes alongside some new accessories ( specifically tailored for these models. With the success the brand has been having since last year’s reveal of the Xafari and Xyber e-bikes, it’s no surprise that the popular brand is further expanding its newest series of commuting solutions. Two of these new e-bikes are aiming to not only fill the broad accessibility space of its previous models, but also further integrate and improve Segway’s already impressive lineup of smart tech, while the third of these models comes as an even higher-end adrenaline rush for off-roading thrill seekers. Release dates are staggered, with one of the e-bikes already available for purchase, while the other two (and the accessories) are going to be released across spring and summer. Head below to get the full rundown on what to expect.
